subject: RE: [junit] weird problem with JUnit and VAJ4
msgSnippet: I suspect a classloader problem.  The textui doesn t need a reloading classloader, but the swingui does.  Your call is probably using the default VM

I suspect a classloader problem.  The textui doesn't need a reloading
classloader, but the swingui does.  Your call is probably using the default
VM classloader.

 - George

> -----Original Message-----
> From: megasycophant 
> 
> I have some tests written that call TestRunner.run(Class) in the 
> main method.  If I set my import to junit.textui.TestClass, 
> everything runs fine, but if I set it to swingui or awtui, it throws 
> a ClassNotFoundException when it makes its Class.forName(...) call 
> to get my test class.  What gives?  textui.TestRunner works, so all 
> of the paths should be fine.  I'm stumped.
